DataElement.preferredName: Prostate Pathology Atypical Small Acinar Proliferation Diagnosis Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a yes/no indicator to ask if growth is identified in clusters of malignant secreting cells lining small saclike dilatations in the prostate gland upon examination of cell and tissue structures.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prostate Pathology Atypical Small Acinar Proliferation Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to growth identified in clusters of malignant secreting cells lining small saclike dilatations in the prostate gland (male reproductive organ) upon examination of cell and tissue structures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A gland in the male reproductive system just below the bladder. It surrounds part of the urethra, the canal that empties the bladder. It produces a fluid that forms part of semen. (NCI-GLOSS):A specialty concerned with the nature and cause of disease as expressed by changes in cellular or tissue structure and function caused by the disease process. (MSH98)

Concepts.definition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.

The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.

Property.preferredName: Atypical Small Acinar Proliferation of the Prostate Gland Diagnosis
Property.preferredDefinition: No Value Exists:The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.longName: Atypical Small Acinar Proliferation of the Prostate Gland
Concepts.definition: Focal proliferation of small acinar glandular cells in the prostate gland with cytologic changes ranging from atypia to highly suggestive of malignancy.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
